result.title: 2004 The Marine Conservation Society - Seasearch, Lyme Bay Dorset, Dive survey
result.name: 2004-the-marine-conservation-society-seasearch-lyme-bay-dorset-dive-survey
result.notes: Two weekends of diving by groups of divers, co-ordinated by Lin Baldock as Marine Conservation Society (MCS) dives, were carried out on 14th/15th August and 16th/17th October 2004 in Lyme Bay.  Ten sites were covered and a total of 37 Seasearch forms completed between the various buddy pairs with 24 divers taking part.  Divers ranged from professional marine biological surveyors and professional photographers to amateur marine biologist volunteers.  Areas surveyed were between Beer Home Ground and Sawtooth Ledges and funding was provided by Devon Biodiversity Records Centre and Seasearch.

extras.value: ["Data is freely available for research or commercial use providing that the originators are acknowledged in any publications produced."]
Dorset Wildlife Trust (originator); Marine Conservation Society (custodian); Dorset Environmental Record Centre (custodian)

organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.
